abstract: As shareholders vote on whether they should have a say in picking board candidates, investors mulling similar proposals at other companies are watching closely.
snippet: As shareholders vote on whether they should have a say in picking board candidates, investors mulling similar proposals at other companies are watching closely.
lead_paragraph: With less than a week until Hewlett-Packard’s annual shareholder meeting, the first at which the contentious issue of investor elections of directors comes to a vote, battle lines have been clearly drawn. A filing made by the company yesterday and a big shareholder’s position are previews of the fireworks that may occur when investors gather at the Hyatt Regency in Santa Clara, Calif., on Wednesday.

headline.main: Battle Lines Are Drawn in Hewlett Proxy Issue
